instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3: What is PPBUS_G3? This is a typo of PPBUS_G3H. When you see PPBUS_G3, assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
logic board liquid damage short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>,

I cleaned around smc and isl area (corrosion)

how can i find this short ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Inject voltage and see what heats up. There is a chance a high side FET is shorted so check all other rails first for shorts to GND before injecting voltage. Start low at 1V and monitor current draw.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
i've not stabilized power supply for inject voltage,

i will check all other rails 

if possible inject with battery 1,5v AAA ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
i ordered psu

I have checked all other rail no shorts, i

i cleaned motherboard with ultrasonic, now no short to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3</SIGNAL>, now i have 4V, any idea ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: What was corroded in the first place? What is the resistance between pins 17/18 and pins 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>? Is <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> 20 ohms?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
17/18 3,2ohms 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 20,4 ohms, <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> 20ohms (replaced because 265ohms)

Corroded in first smc area,  backlight driver area with fuse backlight, next <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> area

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: If <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> was bad the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> usually killed it. Check <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> again and replace ISL.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Check <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> again? Voltage on DCIN pin of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> 20 ohms voltage on dcin pin2 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 16,6V

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Solved bad <RESISTOR>R7025</RESISTOR>, 

have you an explication why lowers <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at 4v 

old value of <RESISTOR>R7025</RESISTOR> is open line

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aurel476, post: 19036"]Solved bad <RESISTOR>R7025</RESISTOR>,

have you an explication why lowers <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at 4v

old value of <RESISTOR>R7025</RESISTOR> is open line[/QUOTE]
Read this data sheet and compare the typical application diagram to that of your schematic and board view. Then read the notes on pin out and operation.
Pages 4, 7, 8 ..... The package and pinout is not the same but I assume the label pins do the same job.

[URL="http://www.intersil.com/content/dam/Intersil/documents/isl6/isl6269a.pdf"]http://www.intersil.com/content/dam/...6/isl6269a.pdf[/URL]
